sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: "Calculate the maximum efficiency of a heat engine that operates between two reservoirs, one at a temperature of 500 K and another at a temperature of 300 K, using the Carnot cycle."
message_2:
To calculate the maximum efficiency of a heat engine operating between two reservoirs using the Carnot cycle, we can use the following formula:

Efficiency = 1 - (T_cold / T_hot)

where T_cold is the temperature of the colder reservoir and T_hot is the temperature of the hotter reservoir. In this case, T_cold = 300 K and T_hot = 500 K.

Efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 500 K)
Efficiency = 1 - 0.6
Efficiency = 0.4

The maximum efficiency of the heat engine operating between the two reservoirs using the Carnot cycle is 40%.
